value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. However, in DAX, if you have multiple IF THEN expressions, there is an easier way of doing it; using a function called SWITCH, this video is about how you can use switch function in DAX and Power BI

value.title: Avoiding circular dependency errors in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to avoid circular dependency errors in DAX! Article and download: https://sql.bi/59891/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #03: Remove single column filters
value.excerpt: Use REMOVEFILTERS in CALCULATE to clear the filter from a column. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt

value.title: Comparing with previous selected time period in DAX
value.excerpt: This video describes how you can create a comparison with the previous time period in a visualization, regardless of whether the time periods are consecutive or not: https://sql.bi/526183/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables)  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Counting working days in DAX
value.excerpt: This video describes a DAX technique to compute the number of working days between two dates. Article and download: https://sql.bi/80301

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Previous year up to a certain date
value.excerpt: This video describes how to compute previous year values up to a certain date in DAX and Power BI. This technique is useful in case the data is presenting incomplete months or years. Article and download: https://sql.bi/352723?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

value.title: Understanding the IN operator in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn the IN operator in DAX, which simplifies logical conditions by checking whether a certain value belongs to a list of values. Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you’ll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You’ll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you’ll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: DAX Table Functions: ALL, FILTER, & VALUES
value.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate DAX Table functions in Power BI with real world scenarios. Also learn how to quickly add these functions in to dynamic calculations in DAX.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #112: Remove blanks from hierarchies with ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: In today's video I am going to show you how you can remove blanks from hierarchies using the DAX Function ISINSCOPE.  I have covered ISINSCOPE before with a more difficult example, so I hope this video will explain it in easier terms and with a useful example.  Link to the previous ISINSCOPE video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sSUCyps_1O4
